intro: Brosimum rubescens, commonly known as the red brosimum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Moraceae family, which includes figs and mulberries. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish flowers that develop into edible, fig-like fruits. The fruits are typically consumed raw or used in local cuisines. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
